item.title: Juniper Hardware Platform Overview
item.description: This post will look at the various juniper hardware platforms and summarise on each. The information presented is taken directly from the juniper product-services page. As there are comparisions of each platform this post will be table heavy. The Switching Platforms: EX Switches QFX Switches The Routing Platforms: MX Routers PTX Routers ACX Routers CTP Routers T4000 Routers The Security Platforms: SRX series firewalls

item.title: Junos Routing Notes
item.description: This post is a review of Juniper Static Routing statements, mainly focusing on these three types: Discard Reject Forwarding (next-hop) 1. Discard In Cisco Terms this is a null route with no ICMP reject notification, this is typically used for advertising summary/aggregate routes to neighboring devices. An example of this would be: Local routes: 10.10.0.0/25 10.10.0.128⁄25 | Aggregate discard route: 10.10.0.0/24 Both /25 local routes can be aggregated into a single /24.
